Topics:
Agile development

CircleCI brings in another $18M in funding in Series B round

May 17, 2016 | By Chris Talbot
Share
Tools
  • Comment
  • Print
  • Contact Author
  • Reprint

Many of the funding announcements lately have revolved around container technology, but as DevOps continues to ramp up in the enterprise, continuous integration and continuous delivery are also getting attention from the investment community. Yesterday, CI/CD vendor CircleCI completed an $18 million Series B funding round that will be used for both product development and the expansion of its existing operations.

The five-year-old company has now brought in a total of $28 million in financing. The latest funding round was led by Scale Venture Partners, but existing investors DFJ, Baseline Ventures and Harrison Metal also participated. At the same time as the funding announcement, CircleCI also named Andy Vitus of Scale Venture Partners to its board of directors.

For Scale Venture Partners, this isn't its foray into the CI/CD space. As noted in the CircleCI press release, Scale Venture Partners previously invested in Chef.

"We are in the midst of a transformation to the software delivery pipeline, mainly driven by the demands for speed as enterprises move toward releasing code daily and hourly. As complexity rises, enterprises large and small have new demands for speed, assurances of quality, and automation, making the software delivery phases a critical business driver," said Vitus, a partner at Scale Venture Partners, in a statement.

CircleCI plans to use the money to beef up its product development efforts, expand its operations and ramp up support for existing and new customers.

For more:
- read the press release

Filed Under
Andy Vitus, Baseline Ventures, CircleCI, Continuous Delivery, Continuous Integration, DFJ, Harrison Metal, Scale Venture Partners
